Guest Came in today. She was grateful for the help the Isipingo Community has provided. There was a Whatsapp Group that highlighted the issues. She advised she had a love child out of wedlock. White MAle Abandoned Ms Storm and Kid. Left Penington to get to Isipingo. Practiced Islam from 94-1996. She Left Islam In 1996 when she went to NRB. The child grew and at age 11 years he felt the need to embrace Islam in Jan 2023 Alhamdulillah he frequents the Masjied and is Going to Mosque. The Guest Has informed us that she is a Qualified Care Giver. She leaves the Child with Pinky when she needs to do after hours care. Guest was Emotional at this visit. POA is that Sr Yasmeen Attends our Job Seeking Programme on the 4 July 2023. Letter From Ml Ahmed Jeewa Al Musjidul Jaami. Attached in File

Sr Yasmeen came into our offices at 15:05pm. Office was closed for Guest However Iqbal Sabat Called Me as i was at a Workshop. Hafez Ariff welcomed the Guest and was assisted by Tasneem N. The Guest did not follow the POA and arrive on the day she was asked to join the Programme on the 4 July 2023. We contacted the Landlord as we had a hand written invoice from Mr MI Ibrahim the reason we called him was last month when interviewed Yasmeen said there was no rental to be paid. Upon Calling the Landlord he advised we can pay what we can afford. He also alerted me that He was responsible for the Engineering at Mr. Iqbal Sabat Home. We assist everyone on the basis of our assesment and not who they know without fear or favour. This Sister will need to comply and follow the POA that the case worker has advised on. From: Cassim Jadwat
Sent: Friday, 02 December 2022 09:42
To: Ariff Shaikh <Ariff.Shaikh@sanzaf.org.za>
Subject: RE: SANZAF National Office - DBN Complaint
AsSalaamUalaikum Ariff
_
As per the caseworker Sr. Rashida Patel & Humza Mthembu(Development):
	Mohamed Mtshali approached SANZAF on 29 April 2022. 
	He was referred by Dr. Afzal Osman.
	He stated that he is a Rigging Engineer who was working in Qatar. His contract ended and he had returned home.
	He has two wives that live separately.
	His first wife(2 children) is gainfully employed at African Bank and pays her own bills.
	The second wife(1 Child) is unemployed.
	His initial request was R4500 for electricity. It was approved and paid by SANZAF.(29/04/2022)
	He was also assisted with a grocery hamper & R500 worth of vouchers.
	He stated that he had applied for several jobs in Qatar and was awaiting feedback.
	His second request was R10 000 for rent and R1 038.24 for electricity for May 2022. 
	Dr. Osman paid R10 000 via SANZAF once off(he wishes to remain anonymous). SANZAF paid R1038.24 for electricity  16/05/2022. 
	He was advised to bring his wife in for development/employment.
	He chose to join the business class. His request was for R57 000 to sell perfumes._
	The business committee only approved him for R5000 as he did not have any business premises or set customers.
	He made a profit of R1000 from the business._
	He then made a request for R40 000 for the business. He was requested to send a business report for two months of operation but he had spent the money on personal expenses. 
	His business request was declined.
	He was advised to follow up with job opportunities. As per the development department his wife chose business over employment but dropped out of the business class. Br. Mohamed did not report back to development on any job applications._
	In the interim he moved from a cheaper flat to a more expensive flat as the landlord had sold the flat. This was done without consultation with SANZAF.
	Please note that during his business training, he was assisted with: _
1.	Rent  June(R4000), July(R4000), August(R4000), September(R4000), October(R2000).
2.	Groceries  April, May, June, July, August, November.
3.	Vouchers -  April(R500), May(R500), June(R500), August(R400), Solidarity voucher(R1000).
	The Shurra committee did not approve any further rental requests as they stated that he had not followed up on employment and had failed in his business. He is able bodied and needed to seek employment urgently as SANZAF gave him sufficient time and opportunities to empower himself.
	He stated that he doesnt want to work in South Africa as per his caseworker and the development department.
	When the caseworker contacted him to advise him that his last rental request was not approved, she encouraged him to return to SANZAFs development department with respect to employment. 
	As per the caseworker, Mohamed stated Thank you so much for all the assistance he received from SANZAF. (22/11/2022).
	That was the last that SANZAF heard from Mohamed.
I hope that this report provides clarity with respect to the recipient, Mohamed Mtshali.
Shukran
Cassim

Salma Mabhoza 6587, it's important to note that the recipient received

APPLICANT USED TO LIVE IN THE STREETS NEAR THE HARBOUR -SANZAF DID A URGENT PLACEMENT AT TAFTA -FAIZAL WAS ABUSED BY HIS SON -PHYSICAL ABUSE-HE ALSO SMOKES MARUWANA-APPLICANT LIKES THE LIFE OF THE STREETS

I was working in China. I got the Corona virus followed by the Chinese respiratory flu. I became weak and fall down. The result was a fractured back, hip, torn thandorm in leg and right arm broken in two places. 

 

I spent over two months in a government hospital in China. The expenses were high. I could not do the required surgery , as for example they required 60 000RMB to do the back operation. I had to return to South Africa for medical treatment. 

 

My father promised to help with expenses in South Africa. I was trapped like a prisoner in the hospital in China. I could not leave until the hospital bill was paid. No help from my family , that is, my father, brother or sister. The medical insurance had to be paid in advance and then claim from the insurance. I did not have the money. Finally some miracles happened. An Egyptian Muslim group offered to help me pay for something towards the caregiver. I did not know them. The good Muslim brothers and sisters who were strangers came to my help, without requiring anything from me. They told me that it was a pleasure to assist me. Secondly a South African student in China came to know of my situation and contacted the South African Minister of foreign affairs. She applied pressure on the RSA ambasy and they applied pressure on the medical insurance which finally agreed to pay part of of hospital bill. 

 

I am in a wheelchair and can't walk as a result of nerve damage. I could start a little walking if I get some specialized treatment, but the government hospital in RSA does not want to give me this treatment. However they were going to do surgery on my arm and leg in December, which they has postponed for April. 

 

When I arrived in Durban my sister refused to help in with accommodation. Moved from place to place with a caregiver like a homeless person. Finally got accommodation where the payment is 5000 a month for a studio room.I have run out of all my funds 

My rent is now 4 months overdue. The caregiver salary is also owing. I have gone through periods of starvation without food. I am not able to work and have not worked for almost a year . My father that was going to assist me passed away after I came to South Africa. The above is a brief account of my situation. I need assistance soon, otherwise I will end up in the streets, where I will not be able to survive for long .

  Thanks
